A Sicilian thematic match Judith Polgar vs Gregory Kaidanov. Annotated by Susan Polgar. http://susanpolgar.blogspot.com/2010/02/match-recap.html

Ini adalah pertandingan dengan tema Pembelaan Sisilia yang digelar di South Carolina Amerika. Judit Polgar dan Gregory Kaidanov dikenal sebagai pakar di pembelaan ini.

Judit surprised Gregory on move 6. She usually plays either the regular Scheveningen with 6.Be2 or the Keres Attack with 6.g4.   Judit mengejutkan Gregory dengan langkah ini, biasanya di memakai Gajah e2 atau serangan Keres di bidak g4.

So far all book moves. The basic key ideas in the Sicilian are: White to launch a ferocious attack on the Kingside while Black to launch a counter attack on the Queenside / Center.  Masih dalam langkah teks, idenya di Pembelaan Sisilia adalah, putih bermain tajam di sayap raja dan hitam di sayap ratu.

This is unusual. 10...Qc7, 10...Nxd4, 10...Bd7, 10...Nd7 are the typical choices. I do not have access to the opening database but I do not recall seeing this move before at this exact order. If Black chooses to play e5, it is usually done right away instead of e6 first then e5.

Now White potentially has a very strong Kingside attack with g4, g5, etc. Black must find a way to create pressure on the Queenside or else Black will have problems.

Now Judit's Knight on c3 is free to go to d5 at the right moment.
Gregory has about 54 minutes, Judit has about 1:20 minutes.
White sacrifices a pawn but she has plenty of compensation for it in the form of a Bishop pair, a weak d6 pawn, space advantage, and superior piece placement.
